valueFormat.notes: Semantic color type for the chip. Determines background/border color

commonMistakes.mistake: Using invalid type value like 'primary' or 'success'
commonMistakes.impact: Falls back to 'default' type
commonMistakes.fix: Use valid types: default, danger, warning, neutral, smart, information, orange, magenta

commonMistakes.impact: Type not recognized, displays as default
commonMistakes.fix: Check InChips documentation for V1 vs V2 type mappings

valueFormat.notes: Visual style variant. 'stroke' shows border only, 'solid' has filled background

commonMistakes.impact: Falls back to default 'stroke' style

valueFormat.notes: REQUIRED: Display text for the chip. Visible label shown to users

commonMistakes.impact: Component throws error or shows empty chip

commonMistakes.mistake: Using very long text without maxWidth
commonMistakes.impact: Layout breaks, chip stretches horizontally
commonMistakes.fix: Set :max-width="150" for long text to enable truncation

valueFormat.notes: REQUIRED: Unique identifier for the chip. Used in click events for tracking which chip was interacted with

commonMistakes.impact: Cannot track which chip was clicked, removal logic breaks
commonMistakes.fix: Always provide unique value: value="chip-1" or :value="item.id"

commonMistakes.mistake: Using duplicate values in chip list
commonMistakes.impact: Cannot distinguish chips, wrong chips get removed
commonMistakes.fix: Ensure each chip has unique value: use item.id or index

valueFormat.notes: Maximum width in pixels. Text truncates with ellipsis when exceeded. Hover shows full text via title attribute

commonMistakes.impact: Type error, maxWidth not applied

valueFormat.notes: Makes the chip label clickable. When true, clicking label emits tagClick event (separate from close button click)

commonMistakes.impact: Cursor changes to pointer but nothing happens on click
Wrong handler called (click is for close button, tagClick is for label)
commonMistakes.fix: Use @tagClick for label clicks, @click for close button

valueFormat.notes: Enables hover and active states. When false, chip has no hover effects

commonMistakes.impact: Conflicting states, label won't be clickable

valueFormat.notes: Shows chip as selected/active with highlighted styling

commonMistakes.impact: Selection state not tracked, chips don't stay selected

payloadFormat.notes: Emitted when close button (X) is clicked. Payload is the chip's value prop

click.when: User clicks the close/remove button on the chip
click.usagePattern: Use @click to handle chip removal from list

commonMistakes.impact: Handler called for wrong interaction (click is close button, tagClick is label)

commonMistakes.mistake: Not removing chip from list on @click
commonMistakes.impact: Chip visually remains after clicking close button
commonMistakes.fix: Filter chip from list: chips = chips.filter(c => c.value !== value)

payloadFormat.notes: Emitted when chip label is clicked (only when actionableLabel=true). Payload is the chip's value prop

tagClick.when: User clicks the chip label/text (not the close button)
tagClick.usagePattern: Use @tagClick for navigation or showing chip details. Requires actionableLabel=true

commonMistakes.impact: Event never fires, clicking label does nothing
Event handler not attached
commonMistakes.fix: Use camelCase in template: @tagClick (or kebab @tag-click if preferred)

performanceNotes: Large chip lists (100+ chips) should use virtual scrolling
Re-creating chip array on every render causes unnecessary re-renders - use stable references
For chip lists, use computed properties to derive display state
Avoid inline event handlers - define methods in setup() for better performance
accessibilityNotes: Each chip has proper ARIA attributes for assistive technologies
Close button has aria-label for screen readers
Use descriptive text labels, not generic 'Tag 1', 'Tag 2'
Selected chips should have aria-pressed or aria-selected state
Ensure sufficient color contrast for all chip types
Support keyboard navigation (Tab to focus, Enter/Space to activate, Delete to remove)
Announce chip removal to screen readers
Group related chips with aria-labelledby for context
